0.12.text:
We’re all good at something, but some people
take things to the next level. From a man

4.58.text:
who can eat metal to a woman who literally
bends in half, join us as we count 10 people

10.13.text:
with incredible talents
10. World’s Most Flexible Woman

18.95.text:
Yes, this is the thumbnail you clicked on.
Julia Günthel, best known as Zlata comes

24.80.text:
from Kazakhstan and is known to be the world’s
most flexible woman, and with some of the

29.17.text:
things she’s able to fit inside, it’s
not so hard to see why. At age 10 she became

33.64.text:
a professional contortionist and by 31 she
made a full career out of her flexibility.

38.93.text:
But how on earth can she be flexible enough
to fit inside a fridge, or a tiny box you

43.65.text:
might ask? Well, the Discovery Channel put
her through an MRI machine and doctors found

48.53.text:
that her ligaments were “as flexible as
those of an infant” And here I am not even

53.37.text:
able to touch my toes…
9. Magnetic Man

58.29.text:
The "Magnetic Man"-- defies laws of gravity
with an extraordinary ability — applying

63.43.text:
the power of psycho kinesis he can raise anything
from metal pans to marble statues, transport

69.20.text:
them through the air to affix to his body,
then creates a force to keep them there — simply

73.82.text:
using mind control.
An avid enthusiast of the phenomenon of psychic

78.51.text:
energy, Miroslaw has developed his skill to
manipulate lifeless objects in mid-air to

83.45.text:
obey his will, even forcing them spin around
or shake. His mental powers are so keen that

88.85.text:
he can jump around while an object is stuck
to his head without losing his mental grasp

93.09.text:
of the item. Miroslaw explains how he employs
psycho kinetics to perform these uncanny feats,

98.44.text:
“It works because I load myself with energy
(I connect myself to it) and at the same time

101.73.text:
I wish for the object to raise.”
Miroslaw has undergone numerous tests for

105.74.text:
his perplexing skill which remains unexplained
by conventional science to date. Although

110.25.text:
Miroslaw Magola is gifted with some of the
strangest abilities in the world which are

115.12.text:
generally regarded as paranormal, his book
is filled with protests against exactly this

119.59.text:
form of categorization. He deals with and
discusses things ‘beyond our world,’ yet

124.40.text:
describes himself as a radical rationalist
and insists on his normality.

129.24.text:
8. The Ear Pump
Wei Mingtang, 55, is a factory worker from

134.45.text:
Guilin city, in Guangxi province, China. About
30 years ago he discovered his ears leaked

139.96.text:
air, so he came up with the idea of using
his ears and a pipe for his -now famous- act:

145.99.text:
inflate balloons with his ears!
On a recent city Spring Festival Party, Wei

150.20.text:
also blew out 20 candles in a line within
20 seconds using a hose leading out from his

159.10.text:
Sixty-four-year-old Thai Ngoc, a vietnamese
farmer, is known around the world for a unique

164.22.text:
talent: he needs no sleep. After getting a
fever in 1973, he hasn't been able to sleep

170.36.text:
and has counted infinite numbers of sheep
during more than 11,700 consecutive sleepless

176.07.text:
nights. "I don't know whether the insomnia
has impacted my health or not. But I'm still

180.87.text:
healthy and can farm normally like others,"
Ngoc said. Proving his health, the elderly

185.69.text:
resident said he can carry two 50kg bags of
fertilizer down 4km of road to return home

191.43.text:
every day.
Ngoc currently lives on his 5ha farm at the

192.43.text:
foot of a mountain busy with farming and taking
care of pigs and chickens all day. His six

193.43.text:
children live at their house in Que Trung.
Ngoc often does extra farm work or guards

194.43.text:
his farm at night to prevent theft, saying
he used three months of sleepless nights to

195.43.text:
dig two large ponds to raise fish.
6. The Loudest Clap and Burp

196.43.text:
70 year-old Zhang Quan is hoping to get into
the record books - by clapping his hands.

201.28.text:
His claps measured 107 decibels, just three
decibels lower than whirling helicopter blades.

206.69.text:
The bad news? local environmental protection
officials say Zhang is so loud, he could face

211.23.text:
arrest for noise pollution if he claps too
often.

214.11.text:
On the other hand we have Paul Hunn, who possesses
the ability to belch at 110 decibels. He achieved

220.46.text:
the Guinness World record for the loudest
burp on the set of The New Paul O'Grady Show,

224.90.text:
London on 24 September 2008. And I am sure
he gets all of the ladies with that talent,

231.71.text:
5. Writing with Tears
56 year-old Ru Anting has a very special talent:

237.75.text:
he can write calligraphy with water he shoots
from his eyes. After sucking up some water

243.15.text:
with his nose, he then sprays it through his
tear ducts, ending up on the paper.

246.88.text:
Ru discovered his unusual talent as a child
while swimming in the river. "Sometimes I

250.95.text:
would swallow water while swimming, and once
I accidentally discovered the water I swallowed

255.28.text:
could be shot out through my eyes. My friends
were all shocked to see it," he said.

259.46.text:
But it wasn't until the 1990s, when Ru lost
his job in a local fertilizer factory after

264.78.text:
more than 20 years, that he began to develop
his unusual talent. After three years of intensive

270.08.text:
training, he found he could shoot water accurately
up to 10ft from his eyes at will.

275.45.text:
4. The Flatulist
Mr Methane, alias former train driver Paul

280.30.text:
Oldfield, claims to be the only performing
professional flatulist in the world, or more

285.39.text:
precisely, a "professional farter". His 'talent'
came to light when he accompanied his sister

290.78.text:
in yoga practice. There, he discovered - to
his surprise and delight - that he was able

295.27.text:
to take in air through the rear, retain it,
and then expel it as and when he chose. At

300.20.text:
first, it was nothing more than a party trick
to entertain fellow railwaymen, but eventually

304.27.text:
Mr Methane found that by careful control,
he could pick out a simple tune. So, let’s

309.46.text:
have a quick listen of what Mr Methane can
do. As you can tell, Simon Cowell was not

342.27.text:
57 year-old Manjit Singh, called the "Ironman",
holds more than 30 world records including

348.53.text:
pulling a double decker bus with his hair,
lifting 85 kg with his ears, and of course,

353.79.text:
pulling a Jet also with his ears! On April
2007, Ironman pulled the aircraft -weighting

359.33.text:
approximately 7.4 tonnes- 12ft along the apron
at East Midlands Airport, UK.

365.59.text:
Speaking after the record attempt, he said:
"I don't feel too bad, I have a little bit

369.69.text:
of pain around the ears but I'm ok." The attempt
raised money for his charity Manjit Fitness,

375.26.text:
which aims to get children living in his native
Mahilpur, India involved in sport.

380.93.text:
2. Iron Crotch
Tu Jin-Sheng, a 50-year-old man from Taiwan,

386.24.text:
is a martial arts grandmaster of Iron Crotch,
a branch of Qigong said to have 60,000 followers

392.92.text:
worldwide. On 2005, he attached his penis
to a truck for a demonstration, and pulled

398.41.text:
it several yards across a car park in Fremont.
About 20 people, most of whom study Qigong,

404.48.text:
the ancient Chinese art of movement and breathing
to increase energy, gathered for the truck

409.37.text:
pull. Its practitioners are known to lift
hundreds of pounds with their genitals to

412.90.text:
increase energy and sexual performance. Just
how this is supposed to help them in the bedroom

417.58.text:
department though, I haven’t quite been
able to get my head around.

421.68.text:
1. Mister Eat It All
French entertainer Michel Lotito is known

426.50.text:
as Monsieur Mangetout (Mister Eat-it-all).
As a famous consumer of undigestables, Lotito's

433.56.text:
performances are the consumption of metal,
glass, rubber and so on in items such as bicycles,

439.27.text:
televisions, a Cessna 150, and smaller items
which are disassembled, cut-up and swallowed.

445.38.text:
The aircraft took roughly two years to be
'eaten' from 1978 to 1980. He began eating

451.52.text:
unusual material while a child and has been
performing publicly since 1966.

456.61.text:
Lotito does not often suffer from ill-effects
due to his diet, even after the consumption

461.52.text:
of materials usually considered poisonous.
When performing he consumes around a kilogram

466.33.text:
of material daily, preceding it with mineral
oil and drinking considerable quantities of

471.39.text:
water during the 'meal'. He apparently possesses
a stomach and intestine with walls of twice

477.15.text:
the expected thickness, and his digestive
acids are, allegedly, unusually powerful,

482.71.text:
allowing him to digest a certain portion of
his metallic meals.
